results.title: The Circus baby
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Picture Book Parade”.
Tells the story of the mother elephant who learns that she should not try to get her baby to act like a human. Iconographic animation. From the book written and illustrated by Maud and Miska Petersham. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Classification
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Piaget’s Developmental Theory”.
Based on the work of Jean Piaget. Shows how a child’s ability to classify in a number of different situations can be used as an index of more general intellectual growth. Demonstrates the “clinical interview” situation used in presenting children with cognitive tasks and gives examples of pre-operational and concrete operational subjects, typical behavioural responses and reasoning.

results.title: Conservation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Piaget’s Developmental Theory”.
This film deals with the distinct developmental changes in a young child’s ability to conserve on a number of tasks. Conservation is defined and the tasks used in the film are conservation of liquid, length, area and volume. The tasks are analysed using a theory suggested by Piaget.

results.title: Formal thought
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Piaget’s Developmental Theory”.
Illustrates tasks that challenge the thinking of postprimary school students. Involves proportional reasoning, separation of variables, combinatorial logic and the integration of these in an analysis of a balanced beam with weights. Suitable for tertiary level and teachers.

results.title: How we begin
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
After discussing external physical differences between the two sexes, the film shows various tuypes of body cells and how cell division takes place in the human embryo after the egg cell has been fertilised.

results.title: Preparation for parenthood
results.creator_credit: Thora James, Frank Wells and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Physiology of Human Reproduction”.
The changes which take place in the body during puberty are shown followed by a brief resume of development of the embryo, lactation, menstruation and how multiple births may occur.
